intro: Macvaughiella standleyi, commonly known as the Mexican orchid, is a rare and unique species native to Mexico. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soil. Its floral structure includes a single, upright spike bearing several small, fragrant blossoms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
